title: On Sacred Ground
creator_contributor_role: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Aboriginal Australians - Politics and government
abstract: On Sacred Ground looks at the story behind the Noonkanbah dispute, the well-publicised Aboriginal struggle to stop mining in the Kimberley region of Western Australia in the late 1970s.
description: Discusses the controversial question of Aboriginal land rights. Deals with the arguments to preserve sacred sites versus the Australian government's agreements with mining companies. Concentrates on the situation at the Noonkanbah Station in Western Australia. Suitable for upper secondary level.
